title: (x) Nespresso logo font - probably custom
content:
Hi all,

can anyone help identify the font on which the Nespresso logo is based on?

Many thanks!
author: ReneRutten

comments.content:
Here is the image. It helps us if you are the one who posts the image.

Obviously the N is custom drawn. The rest is an uneven sans with what I call a type 2 R (where the straight leg comes from the bowl). The closest sans I could find was Unifonts Ziano. (see second sample)

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224546im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Nespresso_6682.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224546im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ZianoNespresso_4125.gif)

[Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224546/https:/www.sevenbuttons.com/UserFiles/Image/Nespresso(1).gif) it is in big size.  
I read the 'stylised N represents a coffee bean'!

Thanks Ben, that makes a different picture completely. The font I picked does actually have small serifs, so it's not too far off, even with the added detail, but now we might find a better match. I think it's probably a custom font, if it's not lettering, but Arrow might be close and there may be some tiny serif fonts worth looking at.

- Mike Yanega

One sort of close style is Marc Tassell's [Pilgrim](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224546/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/pilgrim/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D240%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DNESPRESSO%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D24). It would need to be flattened, but it would be similar.

- Mike Yanega
I think it looks custom too. Those Ss are clunky.

Thanks!  
Sorry for not placing the image. Thought I did...
